Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Rabbi Mark Kaiserman, Rabbi of the Reform Temple of Forest Hills located at 71-11 112 Street, Forest Hills, NY  11375.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Koslowitz.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Mark Kaiserman, Rabbi of the Reform Temple of Forest Hills located at 71-11 112th Street, Forest Hills, N.Y. 11375

Council Member Koslowitz moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of October 28, 2019 and October 30, 2019 be adopted as printed by Council Member Eugene.
Items.MinutesNote: On behalf of Council Member Eugene, Council Member Dromm moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 28, 2019 and October 30, 2019 be adopted as printed.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law in relation to the creation of a task force to study and report on the feasibility of an independent city of Staten Island
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Creation of a task force to study and report on the feasibility of an independent city of Staten Island.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to conforming the New York city energy conservation code to the New York state energy code with amendments unique to construction in the city and incorporate therein provisions of the NYStretch energy code-2020, and to repeal section 28-1001.2 of such administrative code relating to such conforming amendments
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Amendments unique to construction in the city and incorporate therein provisions of the NYStretch energy code-2020, and to repeal section 28-1001.2 of such administrative code relating to such conforming amendments.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to affordable housing lottery processes
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Affordable housing lottery processes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the installation of bollards at bus stops
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Installation of bollards at bus stops.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Homeland Security to grant Temporary Protected Status designation for the Bahamas in the aftermath of the devastation of Hurricane Dorian.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Dept of Homeland Security to grant Temporary Protected Status designation for the Bahamas in the aftermath of the devastation of Hurricane Dorian.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to street markings indicating locations of fire hydrants
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Street markings indicating locations of fire hydrants.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and governor to sign, A.1797/S.6364, which would amend the New York State Penal Law to establish the offenses of reckless endangerment of an emergency service person in the first degree and second degree when individuals knowingly alter or convert a building that impedes egress and results in the injury or death of emergency service personnel.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Establish the offenses of reckless endangerment of an emergency service person in the first degree and second degree when individuals knowingly alter or convert a building that impedes egress and results in the injury or death of emergency service personn

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to introduce and pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation that would extend the State’s property tax levy cap to New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Extend the State’s property tax levy cap to NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the State legislature to increase the cap on commercial overnight fines for cities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Increase the cap on commercial overnight fines for cities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to enhancing civilian enforcement to mitigate construction dust emissions
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Enhancing civilian enforcement to mitigate construction dust emissions.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the New York city housing authority to report on outside legal expenditures
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: Requiring NYCHA to report on outside legal expenditures.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to directing the commissioner of investigation to investigate the misuse of city-issued parking permits
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Oversight and Investigations
Items.MatterName: Directing the commissioner of investigation to investigate the misuse of city-issued parking permits.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 1412-A, 45-0-1 - Abstention: CM Yeger.
Int. No. 1482-B, 43-3-0 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

See files for individual votes.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) adjourned to meet again on Thursday, December 19, 2019.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
